text:
Comment on attachment 16545
solution for FOP to handle large files

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/tooldocs/linux/java.html#options
or
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/tooldocs/windows/java.html#options

It is worth looking this over.	You can get different results by
fiddling with the switches.  For instance, the "-server" switch will
select the HotSpot Server VM, which might be more appropriate for the
bot server.

-Xms sets the initial size of the memory allocation pool.
-Xmx sets the maximum size of the memory allocation pool.  As Jon said,
the default is 64MB.  This is also (redundantly) specified in the server
script provided with Program D.  It should be adequate for one bot but
you may want to increase it for more than one.	For instance, "-Xmx512m"
will allow it to grow to 512MB."

Given that there are still users regularly raising the issue on the mailing list, I suppose that's a yes.

I guess you tweaked your files to make them manageable by FOP (or maybe you're just lucky :-) ). FOP still has issues dealing with big page-sequences.
